intro: Centaurea rupestris subsp. kozanii, commonly known as the Kozan rock-centaurea, is a perennial flowering plant native to the rocky regions of Turkey. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and bright blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in sunny, arid environments. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct adaptations to its specific habitat, making it a notable example of plant diversity in Mediterranean climates. It is often found in limestone or rocky substrates, contributing to the ecological richness of its native range.
